abstract: Representatives from more than 100 countries agree to ban worldwide trade in pangolins, shy mammal native to Asia and Africa, during meeting of Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora; animals are most trafficked mammal in world and severely endangered as result.

keywords.value: Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: An international agreement now prohibits the commercial sale across international borders of the world’s most trafficked mammals. Enforcement is another matter.
snippet: An international agreement now prohibits the commercial sale across international borders of the world’s most trafficked mammals. Enforcement is another matter....

headline.main: Trade Ban to Protect Pangolins: Enough to Save Them?
headline.print_headline: Rescue Mission: A New Focus on a Trafficking Victim
